bibl.title: Letter from John Dickson to Albert E. Truby, October 9, 1939

div1.p: Dickson requests that Truby review a biography of Walter Reed, which is to be included in the "National Cyclopedia of American Biography."

div1.head: Letter from John Dickson to Albert E. Truby, October 9, 1939
div1.opener:
JAMES T. WHITE & CO.
PUBLISHERS
(Founded in 1873)
THE NATIONAL CYCLOPEDIA OF AMERICAN BIOGRAPHY
THE FOREMOST BIOGRAPHICAL AUTHORITY OF THE UNITED STATES
70 FIFTH AVENUE NEW YORK
October 9, 1939.
TELEPHONES {ALOCWOUN 4.7390
{ALOCWOUN 4.7391
EDITORIAL DEPARTMENT
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
Gen. Albert E. Truby,
145 Laurel Street,
San Francisco, Calif.
Dear Gen. Truby:
div1.p:
We have prepared a biography of Dr.
Walter Reed for publication in this Cyclopedia and submitted
a copy of it to his son, Maj. Gen. W. L. Reed, in Washington,
asking him to make such corrections in the article as might
be necessary to have it entirely accurate.

Gen. Reed has now returned the manu-
script to us, suggesting that we forward it to you because
of your “intimate and accurate knowledge of my father's work.”

We are, therefore, sending the copy
on to you and trust you will assist us by going over it and
indicating any changes or additions which you may consider
desirable.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, JOHN DICKSON
Managing Editor C
